title: Overlay | Better Worlds
description: In Elizabeth Bonesteels original short story, a fathers dangerous mission to save his son isnt what it really seems in Overlay.  Read Elizabeth Bonesteels original story here:   Overlay is a part of Better Worlds, The Verges science fiction project about hope.   Directed by: Device Creative Direction: The Verge  Creative Director: William Joel Produced by: Device  Illustration: Device Animation: Device, David Feliu, Sebastian Garcia, Jong-Ha Yoon, Karol Szczepankiewicz  Cleanup: Device, Luke Etcheverry, Sergi Ros, Sheila Hattaf, Jong-Ha Yoon, Karol Szczepankiewicz, Demian Garnero  Screenplay: William Joel Voices by: Kyle Stewart and Michael McDaniel Music: Sono Sanctus  Sound Design & Mixing: Ambrose Yu  Executive Producers: Eleanor Donovan, Nilay Patel Supervising Producer: Sophie Erickson Production Manager: Meg Toth Editorial Director: Helen Havlak General Manager: Steven Belser Network Manager: Sarah Bishop Woods Engagement Editor: Ruben Salvadori Social Media Managers: Dilpreet Kainth, Esther Cohen, Kaitlin Hatton  Subscribe:   Like The Verge on Facebook:  Follow on Twitter:  Follow on Instagram:  Listen to our podcasts:  Read More:  Community guidelines:  Wallpapers from The Verge:   Subscribe to Verge Science on YouTube, a new home base for our explorations into the future of science:
transcript: Im in. I got the layout up. Tell me where you think you are. Copy that. The prison cells are in the southwest quadrant. Im on my way. Sit tight. Like I have a choice. So what am I up against? Well, theres only the one guard on duty. Thats not so bad. Because They have patrol drones. Shit! I think I spot you. All right, Im almost there. I need you to wave your arms in the air. Im sorry? Just do it. Hey! Stop! Dad! Youre grounded. Im a highly trained and decorated agent. And Im your father. Youre grounded. (coughing) Is he okay? Who? Come on. Lets get out of here! Its good to see you. That was close... We arent out of the woods yet. He really loves that simulation, huh? It's based off a movie we used to watch all the time when I was a kid. Being a hero instead of being in pain I figured it wouldnt be a bad way to spend his final days. Is he stable enough to continue? Okay, lets keep saving the world. Ready? Ready.
